content.description: If you are looking for a steep jug haul, climb this route. I saw a line (#2) from Ed Sewall's old photo uploaded by Joe M. This line is also mentioned in the guide book on Gunks app by Dana Seaton. However, I have no idea if this line I'm submitting is that line at all. Just climb it and have fun guys. Start at the cluster of jugs about 5 feet to the right of 5.8 Crack, move up to the crimp near the "B" of "Blunted", make a big throw up to the first tier of the ledge (you will probably end up on a slopper/ crimp). Then match your hands to a real jug on the second tier of the ledge right behind the first tier.Grab a bad crimp or two and reach up and left to an undercling. From the undercling, climb slightly right on jugs until you reach the bottom of the small corner. Grab a hidden sidepull on your left and throw for a pinch before reaching the top of the boulder. Obviously the crack of "5.8 crack" is off route.
content.protection: Top Rope or High ball Pads. Don’t high ball it.
content.location: About 5 feet to the right of "5.8 Crack." To the left of "Zero Gravity".

content.description: #3 on Ed Sewall's old photo, start at crack and climb straight up in the middle of the wall.
content.protection: Long slings to setup toprope anchor.
content.location: Middle of wall, left of obvious roof.

content.description: Climb the slab to the right of the crack.  Has been bouldered.
Climb the obvious crack on the right side of the wall.  Has been bouldered/solo'd.
Climb the arête to the right of the roof finishing up on the race.
Start at the right facing corner under the left end of the obvious roof.  Climb up to a good horn, and then continue straight up.  #4 on the old beta photo.
content.protection: Toprope, though this has been bouldered.

content.description: Start up the shallow right facing corner than traverse the lip of the roof topping out to the right.  #5 on Ed's old photo.  A slightly easier variation is to traverse low around the roof finishing on the right side of the roof.  #5A on the beta photo, goes at 5.11
A nice climb working up positive opposing crimps.
content.location: Sit start on the left side of the right face of the bouldering section. Work your way up some solid opposing crimps to the lip. Top out through the crevasse.

content.description: A quick warm up climb on the right side of the Boulder section at Goat Rock.
content.location: Stand start on the right side of the Boulder face climb up the jugs staying left of the crack separating the ropes climbs. Traverse left and mantle on the platform topping out through the crevasse.

content.description: A really fun and rare Lincoln Woods off-width where the name acts as the key to it's success. Super fun and worth while to learn off-width climbing!
content.location: Start feet first as deep into the mini cave as you can. Pull yourself up into the crack and work your way through the off-width up to the lip. Top out an easy slab the rest of the way.

content.description: A fun little problem arching over the left side of the Chicken Wing crevasse.
content.location: Start on the left side of the Chicken Wing crevasse and make an awkward move up to a positive lip traverse right onto the platform and topout through the crevasse.

content.description: Middle climb if the right face working through some jugs a midway crimp into more jugs.
content.location: Sit start same as Goat Rodeo traverse right into the middle of the face moving into some smaller crimps and to the lip (stay left of Goat Nuggies). Traverse back right to the ledge and top out through the crevasse.

content.description: Obvious crack in the middle of the wall.

The only real toprope area in Lincoln Woods, this area is located at picnic area 9C.  Unless you have very long slings or a static line, trad gear is needed to setup for toproping.  Will add more here very soon...
